program_1.task: Silicon dioxide (SiO2) plasma etching using CHF3-based chemistry

sub_htps.task: Configure plasma chemistry and gas flow rates for selective SiO2 etching
sub_htps.note: CHF3 provides fluorine for etching and sidewall passivation, Ar stabilizes plasma, O2 enhances etch product volatility

sub_htps.task: Set plasma power and pressure conditions for anisotropic etching
sub_htps.note: Higher ICP power increases etch rate but may reduce anisotropy; lower RF power improves profile control

program_2.task: Silicon nitride (Si3N4) etching with high selectivity to oxide

sub_htps.task: Optimize gas chemistry for nitride-selective etching
sub_htps.note: CF4 provides aggressive fluorine chemistry for nitride, CHF3 adds polymerization for selectivity

sub_htps.task: Configure plasma conditions for high selectivity etching
sub_htps.note: Temperature control is critical for selectivity; cooler temperatures generally improve selectivity

program_3.task: Polysilicon gate etching with vertical sidewalls and minimal undercut

sub_htps.task: Set up chlorine-based chemistry for silicon etching
sub_htps.note: Cl2 provides main etch chemistry, HBr adds sidewall passivation, He-O2 helps with polymer removal

sub_htps.task: Control plasma conditions for critical dimension control
sub_htps.note: Balance between etch rate and profile control; endpoint detection recommended for uniform results

program_4.task: Metal interconnect etching for aluminum and copper lines

sub_htps.task: Configure chemistry for metal etch with minimal corrosion
sub_htps.note: BCl3 provides less corrosive etching than pure Cl2, N2 helps with passivation

sub_htps.task: Set plasma parameters for smooth sidewalls and minimal redeposition
sub_htps.note: Lower pressures help reduce redeposition; temperature control prevents resist damage
